p: In neurodegenerative diseases such as ALS, compounds that activate signal-regulated kinase phosphorylation (ERK) and element response-binding protein (CREB) are considered as possible neuroprotective agents. Based on this information, Nakamura et al. tested phosphorylation capacity in human A172 cells of felopterin (39) and auraptene (40) isolated from citrus fruits ( Figure 3). Both coumarins promoted an activation of ERK and CREB, indicating that the coumarin ring is a possible pharmacophore responsible for activating the neuroprotective effect on the central nervous system [ 77].
